name: Gluten-Free Blueberry Muffins made with Coconut Flour
author: King Arthur Flour
summary: In this recipe, a little bit of our coconut flour goes a long way. These quick and easy muffins are beautifully fluffy and moist, and are a great family breakfast treat or a tea-time snack to wow your guests.
ingredients: ¼ cup King Arthur Coconut Flour, sifted after measuring
½ cup fresh blueberries, thoroughly dry
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F
Lightly grease six wells of a standard muffin pan, or line them with lightly greased muffin papers
Sift together the coconut flour and baking powder, and mix until well blended
Stir together the eggs, butter, honey, salt, and vanilla and almond extracts until smooth
Mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until there are no lumps
Gently fold the blueberries into the batter until evenly incorporated
Scoop the batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each about half full
Bake the muffins for about 16 to 18 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean
Let them cool for about 5 minutes in the pan, then transfer them to a rack to cool
